evidence.source_document: USCA Mandate
evidence.text: USCA Mandate (certified copy) as to 55 Notice of Appeal, USCA Number 24-2086. Upon consideration of the MOTION FOR VOLUNTARY DISMISSAL, filed on July 19, 2024, by counsel for the appellants, IT IS ORDERED that the rule to show cause dated July 18, 2024, is DISCHARGED. This appeal is DISMISSED in accordance with Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 42(b).

extracted.value: Appeal: All Plaintiffs appealed to US Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: CLASS ACTION

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The health care provided by Defendants in Wisconsin’s prisons has fallen short of minimum constitutional requirements and failed to meet prisoners’ basic health needs. ... Defendants continue to be deliberately indifferent to the substantial risk of pain and suffering to prisoners, including deaths, which occur due to Defendants’ failure to provide minimally adequate health care, in violation of the Eighth Amendment.

extracted.value: Prisoners in Wisconsin Department of Corrections facilities are denied constitutionally adequate health care and are subjected to cruel and unusual conditions of confinement, resulting in unnecessary pain, suffering, and death.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Case 2:23-cv-01430-WED     Filed 10/26/23     Page 1 of 41

evidence.text: Magistrate Judge William E. Duffin

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs seek injunctive relief to compel Defendants to immediately provide prisoner- Plaintiffs and the class members they represent with constitutionally adequate health care and with protection from unconstitutional conditions of confinement.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Injunctive relief to compel Defendants to immediately provide constitutionally adequate health care and protection from unconstitutional conditions of confinement

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs also requests this Honorable Court for protections from continued unconstitutional conditions of confinement.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: in violation of the Eighth Amendment

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs are represented by counsel experienced in civil rights litigation, prisoners’ rights litigation, and complex class action litigation.
